info.title: DocTrack
info.description:
# DocTrack API Documentation

## Overview
This documentation provides comprehensive information about the Internal Document Tracking Application API (DocTrack). 
DocTrack is a robust system designed to streamline the management of internal documents, their tracking, and the workflow between different departments within an organization.

## Core Features
- **Authentication**: Secure user authentication with role-based access control
- **Document Management**: Create, update, track, and manage internal documents
- **Derivation System**: Forward documents between departments with full tracking history
- **Department Organization**: Manage organizational structure and department hierarchies
- **Employee Management**: Maintain employee records and their departmental associations
- **Charge Books**: Track document reception and responsibility assignments

## API Structure
All API endpoints are organized under the `/api/v1` path and grouped by resource types:
- `/auth` - Authentication and user management
- `/documents` - Document operations
- `/derivations` - Document routing between departments
- `/departments` - Department management
- `/employees` - Employee records 
- `/charge-books` - Document reception tracking
- `/users` - User administration

## Getting Started
1. Authenticate using the `/v1/auth/login` endpoint
2. Use the returned JWT token in the Authorization header for subsequent requests
3. Explore the different endpoints based on your requirements

For technical support or questions about the API, please contact our support team.

get.description: This endpoint returns the authenticated user's details including roles and permissions.
get.summary: Get authenticated user details

post.description: This endpoint allows the authenticated user to change their password.

get.summary: Get all charge books without pagination

message.example: Complete list of charge books retrieved successfully

get.summary:
Get paginated list of charge books

This endpoint returns a paginated list of charge books for the authenticated user's department with optional filtering
Show specific charge book

message.example: Cannot delete charge book older than 24 hours

get.summary:
Get all departments without pagination

This endpoint returns a complete list of all departments without pagination

message.example: Complete list of departments retrieved successfully

get.summary:
Get paginated list of departments

This endpoint returns a paginated list of departments with optional filtering by name and includes employee count

post.summary:
Store a newly created department

This endpoint creates a new department with validated unique name

get.summary: Display the specified department

message.example: Cannot delete department with associated derivations
Cannot delete department with associated documents
Cannot delete department with associated employees

get.summary:
Get all derivations without pagination.

This endpoint returns a complete list of all document derivations related to the authenticated user's department
(either as origin or destination), including details of documents, departments, and derivation history

message.example: Complete list of derivations retrieved successfully

post.summary:
Add a comment to an existing derivation.

This endpoint adds a new comment and optional status update to an existing derivation.
Access is restricted to users from departments involved in the derivation

message.example: You do not have permission to comment on this derivation

get.summary:
Get paginated list of derivations.

This endpoint returns a paginated list of document derivations related to the authenticated user's department
(either as origin or destination) with optional filtering by document, departments, and date range

post.summary:
Store a newly created derivation.

This endpoint creates a new document derivation from the authenticated user's department to another department.
It validates that the document belongs to the user's department and updates the document's derived status

message.example: The destination department cannot be the same as the origin department
The authenticated user does not have an associated department
You can only derive documents that belong to your department

get.summary:
Display the specified derivation.

This endpoint retrieves detailed information about a specific derivation by ID, including its document,
origin and destination departments, and history. Access is restricted to users from departments involved
in the derivation

message.example: You do not have permission to view this derivation

delete.summary:
Remove the specified derivation.

This endpoint deletes a derivation and its associated details.
Access is restricted to the origin department and only within 2 hours of creation

message.example: Cannot delete derivation after 2 hours of creation
You do not have permission to delete this derivation

get.description: This endpoint returns a complete list of all documents for the authenticated user's department.
get.summary: Get all documents without pagination

message.example: Complete list of documents retrieved successfully

get.description:
This endpoint allows downloading the PDF file associated with a document.
Access is restricted to users from the department that created the document.
get.summary: Get the document file for download

message.example: You do not have permission to download this document

get.description:
This endpoint returns a paginated list of documents for the authenticated user's department
with optional filtering by name, subject, registration number, and other criteria.
get.summary: Get paginated list of documents

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new document record with the provided information,
validates the input data, and stores the uploaded PDF file.

message.example: The authenticated user does not have an associated department

get.description:
This endpoint retrieves detailed information about a specific document by ID, including its
registration details and derivation history. Access is restricted to users from the department
that created the document.
get.summary: Display the specified document

message.example: You do not have permission to view this document

put.description:
This endpoint updates an existing document's information with the provided data after validation.
If a new file is uploaded, the old file is deleted and replaced.
Access is restricted to users from the department that created the document.

message.example: You do not have permission to update this document

delete.description:
This endpoint deletes a document by ID, but prevents deletion if the document has derivations
or charge books. Access is restricted to users from the department that created the document.

message.example: Cannot delete document because it has charge books
Cannot delete document because it has derivations
You do not have permission to delete this document
